thread.title: Black Senate Staffer Hired By Sessions Confronts CNN Contributor’s Racist Claims
thread.title_full: Black Senate Staffer Hired By Sessions Confronts CNN Contributor’s Racist Claims

author: Randy DeSoto
title: Black Senate Staffer Hired By Sessions Confronts CNN Contributor’s Racist Claims

organizations.name: least trusted cable news network  cnn

text:
Poll: CNN Earns Title Of Least Trusted Cable News Network 
CNN contributor Angela Rye did not accept Smith’s assessment, saying, “I do not know if Jeff Sessions is racist or not, but I do know that he acknowledged perhaps saying that the NAACP is communist or un-American, an organization that has worked not only to protect the rights of black people in this country, but all people since 1909.” 
“I know that a deputy U.S. attorney, who worked under him said that he called him repeatedly ‘boy’ told him to watch how he talked to white folks,” she added. “I’m not talking about politics, I’m talking about human decency. You don’t call a grown black man ‘boy.'”   
“I don’t think she knows much about human decency,” Smith shot back. “She does not know Jeff Sessions. She’s never met Jeff Sessions.” 
Rye fired back, “Because you are the one black guy that he hired on the committee doesn’t make him a civil rights leader, William! It actually really doesn’t. It makes, it makes, I am not going to. I am going to leave it at that,” she continued with anger in her voice, before cutting herself off. 
“You can leave it at that because you have nothing,” he replied. 
As reported by Western Journalism , shortly after Trump nominated Sessions in November, Smith came to his former boss’ defense against Democrat changes of racism, stemming from the senator’s failure to be confirmed as a U.S. district court judge in the 1980’s.
